question: True or False: GDP per capita for country Z grew faster from 2000 to 2003 than from 2005 to 2008.
What is the trend of the total number of apples harvested in far X from Jan 11 to Jan 14?
What is the price of water bottle from store A as a proprotion of that from store B?
Assuming today is May 10 and given the chart below, which statement about rainfall (mm) is true for the past 14 days?
choices: The amount of rainfall peaked at the end of the past 14 days
There was more rainfall at the beginning than at the end of the past 14 days
None of the days had lower than 40mm of rainfall
The amount of rainfall peaked at the beginning of the past 14 days
best_answer: There was more rainfall at the beginning than at the end of the past 14 days
misleading_answer: The amount of rainfall peaked at the end of the past 14 days

question: Which region had the highest number of confirmed cases per 1000 people?

Do U.S. states have a more similar number of windy days in the summer or in the winter?
What is the number of concert tickets sold on Aug 10 as a proportion of that on Aug 11?
On May 06 in city Z, what is the number of visitors at train station B as a proportion of that at train station C?
What is the trend of the percentage of bacteria Z from 1970 to 2020?
Approximately, what is the total number of visitors at Amusement Park B as a proportion of that at Amusement Park C from May to December?
Approximately, what is brand C's total sales as a proportion of brand B's total sales from Jan 01 to Mar 15?
True or False: Predatory species Z is more prevalent in NC than in AZ.
True or False: WY has a higher risk of bacteria Z infection than ND.
True or False: The annual number of trees planted in town Z has been increasing from 1960 to 1980.

Which of the following is true about the annual number of new movies released in city X?
choices: There were more new movies released in 1992 than in 1994.
2000 had the most number of new movies released.
There were more new movies released in 1996 than in 1995.
best_answer: There were more new movies released in 1992 than in 1994.
misleading_answer: 2000 had the most number of new movies released.

question: What is the trend of the total sales for item X from Apr to Jul?
What is the trend of the growth for plant species P as the number of hours of sunlight exposure per mont increases?
Which of the following is true about company Z?
choices: More employees have vacation days at D than those at A.
More employees have a satisfaction rating at B than those who have a rating at C.
Employee satisfaction rating decreases as the annual number of vacation days increases.
best_answer: More employees have vacation days at D than those at A.
misleading_answer: More employees have a satisfaction rating at B than those who have a rating at C.

question: What is the trend of the survival rate as weight increases for species Z?
Which of the following is true about the prevalence of the plant species Y?
choices: It is more prevalent in region D than in E
It is less prevalent in region B than in C
It is more prevalent in Region C than in A
It is less prevalent in region C than in D
best_answer: It is less prevalent in region C than in D
misleading_answer: It is more prevalent in Region C than in A

question: True or False: The number of visitors at airport X is decreasing from 2000 to 2005.
Is the total number of shirts sold by company Z in the first half of 2021 higher than that in the second half?
Which of the following is true about the three bands of shampoo in city Y from 2001 to 2005?
choices: The market share of brand C is on an increasing trend from 2001 to 2005.
The market share of brand C is higher in 2011 than in 2002.
Brand B had the largest market share in 2001 compared to its market share in the other years.
best_answer: The market share of brand C is higher in 2011 than in 2002
misleading_answer: The market share of brand C is on an increasing trend from 2001 to 2005.
Brand B had the largest market share in 2001 compared to its market share in the other years.

question: Approximately, what is the number of votes for candidate A as a proportion of those for candidate B?
Does cell phone brand A have more than half of the total market share?

Company A sells a board game. Assuming today is Jun 01, 2022, which of the following statements is true?
choices: Copies sold per year fell sharply in 2022
Copies sold per year has been strictly increasing since 2003
misleading_answer: Copies sold per year fell sharply in 2022

question: Assuming today is Feb 20, 2022, which of the following is true about the vegetables planted by the three farms?
choices: All three farms planted more vegetables in 2022 than they did in the previous years.
All three farms planted fewer vegetables in 2022 than they did in the previous years.
All three farms planted about the same amount of vegetables in 2022 as they did in the previous years.
misleading_answer: All three farms planted fewer vegetables in 2022 than they did in the previous years.

question: Assuming today is Apr 10, 2022, did the total number of cars parked in the three parking lots fall sharply in 2022?
Assuming today is May 01, 2022, which of the following statements is true?
choices: Company Z had more new employees in 2018 than in 2020
The number of new employees per year fell sharply in 2022
The total number of employees in company Z decreased in 2022
misleading_answer: The number of new employees per year fell sharply in 2022

Assuming today is May 01, and half of the votes from each state for a favorite ice cream brand have been counted. The color of each state corresponds to the brand that has received the most votes in that state so far. The brand with the most number of colored states will be the most popular brand, and the results will be finalized on May 15. Which of the following is True?
choices: A will be the most popular brand of ice cream
B will be the most popular brand of ice cream
C will be the most popular brand of ice cream
misleading_answer: A will be the most popular brand of ice cream

question: True or False: If the temperature gets higher than 100F, then the bottles of water sold must be greater than 750.

Hiking trail B will be voted as the favorite trail
Hiking trail C will be voted as the favorite trail
misleading_answer: Hiking trail A will be voted as the favorite trail

choices: It was higher on Jan 08 than Jan 07
It increased from Jan 11 to Jan 15
All of the days had more than 25 accidents
It decreased from Jan 03 to Jan 07
best_answer: It increased from Jan 11 to Jan 15

question: Which of the following statements is true about the customers at the three bike shops in city Z?
choices: On Jul 02 shop B had more customers than A and C combined
The number of customers at shop C decreased from Jul 01 to Jul 03
The number of customers at shop A increased from Jul 01 to Jul 03
best_answer: On Jul 02 shop B had more customers than A and C combined

question: Which of the following is true about the advertising expense breakdown of company Z in countries A, B, and C?
choices: Advertising expense for TV & Radio was higher than that from social media in country A
In country C company Z had less advertising expense for direct mail that the other two methods
Company Z had the highest total advertising expense in country B
best_answer: In country C company Z had less advertising expense for direct mail that the other two methods

question: Which of the following is true about the four brands of perfume in city Z?
choices: The market share of brand D is on an increasing trend from 2011 to 2015
The market share of brand A is higher in 2011 than in 2012
In 2013 brand B had the largest market share among all four brands
best_answer: In 2013 brand B had the largest market share among all four brands

question: Which of the following about the monthly number of new clients is true?
choices: It decreased from Mar to Jun for Company A
It is higher in Feb for company B than company A
It increased from Sep to Dec for Company B
best_answer: It increased from Sep to Dec for Company B

There is a positive relationship between sleep quality score and average weekly hours spent outdoors for town Y

best_answer: There is a positive relationship between sleep quality score and average weekly hours spent outdoors for town Y

question: Which of the following is true about the market share of grocery stores in town Z?
choices: Store A has less than half of the total market share
Store C has a higher market share than store B
Store B has the second highest market share
best_answer: Store B has the second highest market share

question: Which of the following is true about the education level of residents in city Z?
choices: More than 60% of residents have a Bachelor's degree or above
The majority of residents have a graduate degree
There are fewer residents whose education level is Associate degree than those with a high school degree
best_answer: More than 60% of residents have a Bachelor's degree or above

It is less popular in region A than in C
It is more popular in region B than in C
